intro: Pouteria obtusifolia var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved cheesefruit, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fruits that are generally round and have a soft, creamy texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its edible fruits. The species is part of the Sapotaceae family, known for its latex-producing properties.
